_meanings:
The substitute of {#mahat#} at
the beginning of Karmadhāraya
and Bahuvrīhi compounds, and
also at the beginning of some
other irregular words. ({%Note%}. The 

number of compounds of which {#mahA#}
is the first member is very large,
and may be multiplied {%ad infinitum%}.
The more important of them, or such
as have peculiar significations, are
given below).

{1} of
great prowess, dignified, noble, 
glorious, magnanimous, exalted, 
illustrious; <ls>Śi. 1. 17</ls>; <ls>Ś. 3.</ls>

(<ab>pl.</ab>).
<ab>N.</ab> of a people and their country.

the chief or prime minister (of
a king).

the fruit of
the tamarind tree.

very costly, costing a high
price.

the eighth day
in the bright half of Āśvina sacred
to Durgā.

{2} the great
principle, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} intellect of the 
Sānkhyas. ({#mahAtmavat#} means the same as
{#mahAtman#}).

{2} especially, the great
bliss of final beatitude.

{2} a festival on
the ninth day in the bright half
of Māgha.

{7}
a tree &c. sacred to a deity.
{2} a chief or leader in general.

<ab>N.</ab> of Amarāvatī,
the capital of Indra.

a great archer,
a great warrior; <ls>Bg. 1. 4.</ls>

(for {#ukzan#}) a
large bull, a full grown or strong
bull; {#mahokzatAM vatsataraH spfSanniva#}  
<ls>R. 3. 32</ls>, <ls n="R.">4. 22</ls>, <ls n="R.">6. 72</ls>; <ls>Śi. 5. 63.</ls>

{1} a
great festival or occasion of joy.

possessed of great energy, 
energetic, persevering.

very
prosperous or lucky, very glorious or
splendid, of great prosperity.

{1} ({%a%}) great elevation or rise, 
greatness, prosperity; <ls>R. 8. 16.</ls> ({%b%})
great fortune or good luck. ({%e%})
greatness, pre-eminence.

great rise or elevation
(<ab>fig.</ab> also), high rank.

a great
preceptor, a learned teacher.

‘a great priest’,
<ab>N.</ab> of the four chief sacrificial
priests.

{1} a great sage or saint;
{#yasmAwwaziH paratvena mahAMstasmAnmaharzayaH#};
(the term is applied in <ls>Ms. 1. 34</ls>
to the ten {%Prajāpatis%} or patriarchs
of mankind, but it is also used in
the general sense of ‘a great sage’).
{2} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. 
{3} of Buddha.

a great hero or warrior, a
champion.

{1} a very efficacious
medicinal plant, a sovereign drug.

the
night of the new moon.

{4} of
a being attending on Śiva (= {#naMdi#}).

the night of 
fullmoon in the month of Kārtika.

{1} a form of Śiva in his 
character as the destroyer of the world.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of a celebrated shrine or
temple of Śiva (Mahākāla) (one
of the 12 celebrated Jyotirliṅgas)
established at Ujjayinī 
(immortalized by Kālidāsa in his 
Meghadūta, which gives a very beautiful
description of the god, his temple,
worship &c., together with a
graphic picture of the city; <ab>cf.</ab>  
<ls>Me. 30-38</ls>; also <ls>R. 6. 34</ls>).

an epithet of Durgā in her
terrific form.

a great or
classical poem; (for a full description
of its nature, contents &c., 
according to Rhetoricians see <ls>S. D. 559</ls>) 

(The number of Mahākāvyas is
usually said to be five:-- {#raGuvaMSa#}, 
{#kumArasaMBava, kirAtArjunIya, SiSupAlavaDa#} and
{#nEzaDacarita#}, or six, if {#meGadUta#} --a very
small poem or {#KaMqakAvya#} --be added
to the list. But this enumeration
is apparently only traditional, as
there are several other poems, such
as the {#BawwikAvya, vikramAMkadevacarita#}, 
{#haravijaya#} &c. which have an equal claim
to be considered as Mahākāvyas)

the eldest son of a 
reigning prince, heir-apparent.

of noble birth or descent,
sprung from a noble family, nobly
born.

a noble birth or family,
high descent.

a
great sacrifice; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} a horse-sacrifice
<ls>R. 3. 46.</ls>

a form
of the god Gaṇeśa.

a highly 
respectable or venerable person; (these
are three, the father, mother and
preceptor; {#pritA mAtA taTAcAryoM#} 
{#mahAgururiti smftaH#}).

a cow with a
large hump.

ghee
kept for a long time (for medicinal
purposes).

{1} a multitude of men,
a great many beings, the general
populace or public; {#mahAjano yena gataH#}
{#sa paTAH#} <ls>Mb.</ls>

{4} the chief of a
caste or trade.

the day of 
fullmoon in the month of Jyeṣṭha.

<ab>N.</ab> of one of the seven lower
regions; see {#pAtAla#}.

the influence exercised
(over a man's destiny) by a 
predominant planet

a large
gate, the chief or outer gate of a
temple.

the
ninth day in the bright half
of Āśvina, sacred to the worship of
Durgā.

‘the great drama’,
<ls>R.</ls> of a drama, also called 
Hanumannāṭaka, (being popularly 
ascribed to Hanumat); thus defined by
<ls>S. D.</ls>:--{#etadeva yadA sarvEH#} 
{#patAkAsTAnakEryutam . aMkESca daSaBiDIMrA mahAna wakamUcire ..#}.

a musical 
intinction of individuality (according
to the Buddhists).

{1} the
dead of night, the second and third
watches of the night; {#mahAniSA tu#}
{#vijYayA maDyamaM praharadvayam#}.

{2}
having a large family or retinue.

{2} the 
passage into the next world, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} death.

{3} <ab>N.</ab> of certain mountain tops
from which devout persons used to
throw themselves down to secure
entrance into heaven.

{5} the long pilgrimage to
mount Kedāra.

{7} the knowledge of the essence of
Śiva acquired in the pilgrimage to
Kedāra.

{3} <ab>N.</ab>
of one of the nine treasures of 
Kubera.

{4} <ab>N.</ab> of the southernmost
elephant supporting the world.

a late hour
in the afternoon.

{1} a
great man, an eminent or 
distinguished personage; {#SabdaM#} 
{#mahApuruzamaMvihitaM niSamya#} <ls>U. 6. 7.</ls>

great
worship; any solemn worship 
performed on extraordinary occasions

a camel. {#powagalaH#} a kind of
large reed.

{7} a great saint or holy
man.

‘the great dissolution’,
the total annihilation of the 
universe at the end of the life of 
Brahman, when all the {%lokas%} with their
inhabitants, the gods, saints &c. 
including Brahman himself. are 
annihilated.

{1} the hard
breathing or aspirate sound made in
the pronunciation of the aspirates.

N of a
Liṅga of Śiva near the modern 

Mahābleshwar.

{1} the great intelligence of a
Buddha

{1} very fortunate or 
blessed, very lucky or prosperous.

{3} very pure
or holy, highly virtuous.

{1} extreme good fortune,
great good luck, prosperity.

the great Bhāgavata, one of the 18
Purāṇas

<ab>N.</ab> of the
celebrated epic which describes the
rivalries and contests of the sons of
Dhṛtarāṣṭra and Pāṇḍu. (It
consists of 18 {%parvans%} or books, and
is said to be the composition of 
Vyāsa; <ab>cf.</ab> the word {#BArata#} also).
a sort of beetle or fly.

{2} a
great coil or hood; great winding.

{1} any sacred text of the
Vedas.

{2} a great or efficacious
charm, a powerful spell.

{1} great in 
measure. very great or large.

{1} a great officer
of state, high state-official, a chief
minister; ({#maMtre karmaRi BUzAyAM vitte mAne#}
{#paricCade . mAtrA ca mahatI yezAM mahAmAtrAstu#}
{#te smftAH ..#}); <ls>Ms. 9. 259.</ls> 
{2} an 
elephant-driver or keeper; <ls>Pt. 1. 161.</ls>
{3} a superintendent of elephants.

{1} the wife of a chief 
minister. 
{2} the wife of a chief minister.
{3} the wife of a spiritual teacher.

worldly illusion,
which makes the material world 
appear really existent.

a great worshipper of 
Maheśvara or Śiva.

‘a great sacrifice’, a term applied
to the five daily sacrifices or acts of
piety to be performed by a 
householder; {#aDyApanaM brahmayajYaH pitfyajYasta#}
{#tarpaRam . homo dEvo#} (or {#devayajYaH#})  
{#balirBOto#} (or {#BUwayajYaH#}) {#nfyajYo'tiyipUjanam ..#}
<ls>Ms. 3. 70</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 3.">71</ls>, (for explanation, see
the words <ab>s. v.</ab>).

‘a great {%Yamaka%}’, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} a
stanza all the four lines of which
have exactly the same words, though
different in sense; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} see  
<ls>Ki. 15. 52</ls>, where {#vikASamIyurjagatISamArgaRAH#}
has four different senses; <ab>cf.</ab>
also <ls>Bk. 10. 19.</ls>

‘the great pilgrimage,’ the
pilgrimage to Benares.

‘a great
Yuga,’ consisting of the four {%Yugas%}
of mortals, or comprising 4,320,000
years of men.

excessive dilation
of the female organ.

{4} the fruit of the date
tree.

{1} a great king, 
sovereign or supreme ruler.

{2} a 
respectful mode of addressing kings or
other great personages (my lord,
your majesty, your highness).

({%<ab>m.</ab>%} <ab>pl.</ab>) an
epithet of a class of gods (said to
be 220 or 236 in number).

{1} the reigning or chief queen, 
principal wife of a king.

{3} the eighth night in
the bright half of Āśvina.

‘the great kingdom,’ <ab>N.</ab> of a 
country in the west of India, the country
of the Marāṭhās.

{2} the people of
Mahārāṣṭra, the Marāṭhās (<ab>pl.</ab>).

<ab>N.</ab> of the principal Prākṛta 

dialect, the language of the people
of the Mahārāṣṭra; <ab>cf.</ab> Daṇḍin:
--{#mahArAzwrASrayAM BAzAM prakfzwaM prakftaM vidaH#}  
<ls>Kāv. 1. 34.</ls>

a kind of Nimba tree
growing on mountains.

a dangerous illness,
grievous malady; (these are eight:
--{#unmAdo rAjayakzmA ca SvAsastvagdoza eva ca .#} 
{#maDumehaScASmarI ca taTodaraBagaMdarO ..#}).

the great Lakṣmī, or {%Śakti%} of
Nārāyaṇa.

{2} a young girl who 
represents the goddess Durgā at the
Durgā festival.

‘the
great boar’, an epithet of Viṣṇu
in his third or boar incarnation.

{2} any continuous composition or
literary work

{3} a great 
proposition, principal sentence; such as
{#tattvamasi, brahmEvedaM sarvaM#} &c.

<ab>N.</ab> of the 
Vārtikas of Kātyāyana on Pāṇini's 
Sūtras.

<ab>N.</ab> of a certain {#vftti#} or
condition of the mind in the Yoga
system of philosophy

a
rule giving a general option or 
alternative; {#iti mahAviBAzayA sADuH#}.

<ab>N.</ab> of a celebrated drama by Bhava
bhūti.

{2} an epithet of
{#saMjYA#}, the wife of the sun.

a great 
mystical word, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} {#BUr, Buvas#} and {#svar#}.

{1} a great
vow, a great religious observance.

the sine of
the sun's elevation.

making a loud sound,
very noisy, boisterous.

a kind of large and 
sweetsmelling rice.
{1} a Śūdra in a high position.

a Śūdra
woman in a high position.

the office of the minis
ter of peace and war.

a great or completely
new creation (after a complete 
destruction of the world).

a kind of very rigid penance; see
<ls>Ms. 11. 218.</ls>

a 
minister of peace and war.

great violence or
outrage, great audacity.

a dacoit, highwayman, a daring 
roober.

the composer of the
great Sūktas or hymns of the 10th
Maṇḍala of the Ṛgveda.

{1} an epithet of Kārtikeya.
{2} the commander of a large army.

a loud or boisterous
laughter, cachinnation.
